div.p: The size of SIU I really liked
like our community is really tight
The college of engineering I know pretty much the whole class
because we are so small and your teachers are really friendly
and there’s lots of stuff to do here outside and inside
At some bigger schools they have
hundreds of people in their classrooms and there’s no interaction between the faculty and the students
students and down here it's a lot more accommodating to people and individuals
I haven't had a professor I don't like yet
I really like all of them they are all really passionate about what they do
and they all really want you to learn they want you to succeed
It's a lot of fun especially classes with labs you get a lot of hands on experience
which is nice because it's not all theoretical ideas that your learning
you get to apply those concepts that you learn in class
You have at least four classes with labs
you have design electives
where you actually pick apart things and fix things
and a design class a senior design class where you build something
We participate in all kinds of stuff like volunteer activities
the moon buggy team the race car team
we go to conferences twice a year
we have design competitions we have social events and we participate with all other organizations in the college of engineering
We design and build a moon buggy for a competition at the NASA space camp
it's nice to have seen what I have seen as well as see the club come as far as it has
I don't know anyone who didn't have an internship this summer
we've got Caterpillar the Environmental Protection Agency Boeing John Deere
Caterpillar is a company I've wanted to work for since I was a little kid playing with my toy Tonka trucks
all the big yellow construction machinery that’s exciting for a little kid
and continued to be something that I wanted to get into
You know we're really proud of this school that we have we've got a really good engineering school
and we work really hard to keep it up and keep up our reputations
I'm really proud of our hard work
